Description: Gerber Products Co. agreed to settle findings of hiring discrimination against 1,912 rejected minority and female applicants for entry-level positions. The agreement settled allegations that Gerber engaged in hiring discrimination against minority and female applicants for one year.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/opa/media/press/esa/esa20090969.htm

Company: Nestl USA, Inc. dba PowerBar, Inc.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Coca-Cola, Nestle and their joint venture Beverage Partnership Worldwide agreed to pay a total of $650,000 to settle multistate litigation alleging that they made questionable claims while marketing a green tea beverage called Enviga. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the amount was split evenly between them.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20100202214248/http:/www.azag.gov/press_releases/feb/2009/Enviga%20Release.pdf
